result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda M Colyott

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM Defendant Amanda M Colyott in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates she reached out to the SPD office and has been waiting the appointment of counsel. 
State indicates they are waiting on lab work to come back. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda M Colyott in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Request for refusal hearing filed by defendant; Refusal has not yet been filed.
